com.digi.xbee.api.packet.raw

Class TX64Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeePacket
      • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeeAPIPacket
        • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.raw.TX64Packet

  • public class TX64Packet
extends XBeeAPIPacket
    This class represents a TX (Transmit) 64 Request packet. Packet is built using the parameters of the constructor or providing a valid API payload.

    A TX Request message will cause the module to transmit data as an RF Packet.

    See Also:
    XBeeAPIPacket

    • Constructor Detail

      • TX64Packet

        public TX64Packet(int frameID,
                  XBee64BitAddress destAddress64,
                  int transmitOptions,
                  byte[] rfData)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new TX64Packet object with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        frameID - Frame ID.
        destAddress64 - 64-bit address of the destination device.
        transmitOptions - Bitfield of supported transmission options.
        rfData - RF Data that is sent to the destination device.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frameID < 0 or if frameID > 255 or if transmitOptions < 0 or if transmitOptions > 255.
        NullPointerException - if destAddress64 == null.
        See Also:
        XBeeTransmitOptions, XBee64BitAddress

    • Method Detail

      • createPacket

        public static TX64Packet createPacket(byte[] payload)
        Creates a new TX64Packet object from the given payload.
        Parameters:
        payload - The API frame payload. It must start with the frame type corresponding to a TX64 Request packet (0x00). The byte array must be in OperatingMode.API mode.
        Returns:
        Parsed TX (transmit) 64 Request packet.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if payload[0] != APIFrameType.TX_64.getValue() or if payload.length < or if frameID < 0 or if frameID > 255 or if transmitOptions < 0 or if transmitOptions > 255.
        NullPointerException - if payload == null.
